channel.title: MySQL and SQLYog help
channel.description:
okay i got the following procedure to work but the problem is that i want to see the actual command that you would write inorder for the procedure to work like if i wanted to import the data from the table into the fall073 database how would i do that NOT THROUGH the GUI but so i can see the command. im using SQLYog Community Edition -MySQL GUI v.8.14
Stored Procedure 5.
db = fall073 // table = // stored procedure name = CreateFullDatabase import the following tables into the database Norman: the language table from myworld with data the accounts table from fall073 without data
thanks

item.title: MySQL and SQLYog help
item.dc:creator: @darkilla darkilla
item.description:
@darkilla wrote:

okay i got the following procedure to work but the problem is that i want to see the actual command that you would write inorder for the procedure to work
like if i wanted to import the data from the table into the fall073 database how would i do that NOT THROUGH the GUI but so i can see the command.
im using SQLYog Community Edition -MySQL GUI v.8.14

Stored Procedure 5.

db = fall073 // table = // stored procedure name = CreateFullDatabase
import the following tables into the database Norman:
the language table from myworld with data
the accounts table from fall073 without data

thanks
